page.title: 02NEWTOWN SETTLEMENT PATTERN
page.content: The population of this area, estimated at 1,400, is very scattered, but there is the village of Newtown and part of North Boarhunt. There are remnants of settlements at Hoegate, World's End, Hipley and Southend. Newtown, formerly part of Soberton, became in 1850 a separate ecclesiastical parish. Land for the building of the church,school and glebe house was given by the Rookesbury Estate. The age of the houses varies from 16th and 17th century farmhouses to modern. The majority of post 1960's housing has been infilling or replacement of an older property although many are modernised and enlarged. There are no private housing estates and only one block of 14 council build houses at N. Boarhunt, some having been sold to the occupants. There are several mobile homes.
